info.name: Gateways exercise
info.description: Sample api that manages Gateways and asociated Devices. The api provides basic CRUD operations for both Gateway and Device resources. In addition, the gateway resource provides the required endpoints to attach and detach devices from a gateway.

item.name: Gateways

request.description:
Creates a gateway resource in the server. A create request to this endpoint is successful when two conditions are met:

  • serialNumber: there are not other gateways with the provided serial number

  • ipAddress: the IP address provided follows a valid format.

If one of these conditions are not met a 400 response code is returned along with a message indicating the violated constraint. Examples for successful and not successful requests are provided for this endpoint.

response.name: Create Gateway: Unique Serial number constraint violated
Create Gateway: Not valid ip address

request.description:
Updates the information of an existing gateway record. When updating a gateway it must be taken into account that:

*   If the serial number is modified, it must be unique (no other gateway can have the same serial number), otherwise a 400 response code will be returned along with a Not Valid Gateway Error.
*   The provided IP address must be valid, otherwise a 400 response code will be returned along with a Not Valid Gateway Error.
*   If the gateway specified by the path variable does not exists a Gateway Not Found Error will be returned along with a 400 response code.

Retrieves all gateway records. If at least a gateway exist a 200 response code will be returned along with the existing gateways. If no gateway exist a 204 response code will be returned indicating that there are no gateway records.

Retrieves the gateway specified by the path variable of the endpoint. If the specified gateway exists a 200 response code will be returned along with the requested gateway record. If it does not exist a 204 response code will be returned.

Retrieves all devices attached to a specified gateway. If the specified gateway has at least one device attached a 200 response code will be returned along with a list containing the devices of a gateway. If no device is attached to the gateway a 204 response code will be returned.

Attaches a device to a gateway. This request will be successful if:

  1. The gateway specified in the first path variable exist. If this condition is not met a Gateway Not Found Error message will be returned along with a 400 response code.

  2. The device specified in the second path variable exist. If this condition is not met a Device Not Found Error message will be returned along with a 400 response code.

  3. The device limit of the gateway is not exceded (the amount of devices currently attached is strictly inferior to the device limit). If this condition is not met a Device Limit Error message will be returned along with a 400 response code.

response.name: Gateway Attach Device: limit exceeded
Gateway Attach Device: Attach unexisting device
Gateway Attach Device: Attach to unexisting gateway

request.description:
Detaches a device from a gateway. This request will be successful if:

  1. The gateway specified in the first path variable exist. If this condition is not met a Gateway Not Found Error message will be returned along with a 400 response code.

  2. The device specified in the second path variable exist. If this condition is not met a Device Not Found Error message will be returned along with a 400 response code.

response.name: Gateway Detach Device: detaching unexisting device
Gateway Detach Device: unexisting gateway
Gateway Detach Device: unexisting device

request.description: Deletes the specified gateway from the server. This request is successful if the specified gateway exists, in which case it will return a 200 response code. If the specified gateway does not exist a 204 response code will be returned.

item.description: This collections provides examples for managing the gateway resource.

item.name: Devices

request.description:
Creates a device resource in the server. This request will be successful and return a 200 response code along with the created resource if:

  • An uid is provided.

  • There is no device with the provided uid.

If the above conditions are not met a 400 response code will be returned along with a Not Valid Device Error. When creating a device it should be taken into account that: * If no vendor is provided, a device resource with no vendor will be created. * If no createdAt date is provided a device resource with the current date and time from the server will be created. * If no deviceStatus is specified a device resource with ONLINE status will be created.

Retrives all devices stored in the server. If at least one device exists list with existing devices will be returned along with a 200 response code. If no device exist a 204 response code will be returned.
Retrieves the specified device from the server. If the device specified by the path variable exist it will be returned along with a 200 response code. Otherwise, a 204 response code will be returned.

Updates the specified device with the information provided. When updating a device it must be considered that:

*   If the the device specified by the path variable does not exist, a Device Not Found error will be returned along with a 400 response code.
*   If the uid is updated, the provided uid must not assigned to another device, otherwise a Not Valid Device Error will be returned along with a 400 response code.
*   If no createAt date is provided, the value of the current device will not be modified.

response.name: Update device: Device Not Found

request.description: Removes the specified device resource from the server. If the device specified by the path variable exist a 200 response code will be returned, otherwise a 204 response code is returned.

item.description: This collection contains examples for managing the device resource.
